bibl.title: Letter from James E. Peabody to Philip Showalter Hench, January 6, 1942

div1.p: Peabody fears that the war will interfere with Hench's efforts to create a Camp Lazear memorial.

div1.head: Letter from James E. Peabody to Philip Showalter Hench, January 6, 1942
div1.opener:
281 LOWELL AVENUE
NEWTONVILLE, MASS.
Jan. 6, 1942.
Acknowledged, 1-13-42
Dear Dr. Hench:-
div1.p:
I wonder if you received the
long type written letter I sent you
several weeks ago. I tried to answer
your question, but I fear it was
unsatisfactory

Now that the war is really on
my dream of helping out your
plan of restoring the hut in Cuba
may be a wild dream. Anyhow
the review of Welch's book gave
one a very pleasant hour with
my old friend Flexner.
